ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: The Council of the Borough of Bournemouth

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: The Council of the Borough of Bournemouth
ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Bournemouth Borough Council, The Town Hall, Bourne Avenue

TITLE.P: Short Break Daytime Activities for Children and Young People with a Disability

SHORT_DESCR.P: This Framework is for the Provision of Short Break daytime activities for children and young people with a disability residing within the Bournemouth conurbation. Sessions will be required to take place outside of school hours, during holiday periods, weekends and after school.
The Tender is split into two lots:
Lot 1 — Services for 5-18 year olds.
Lot 2 — Stay and Play activities, 3 – 10 year olds.

The Framework is for 3 years with the option to extend the framework for a further 3 years. Therefore, if all extensions were taken, the full length of the contract would be for 6 years. It is anticipated that the contract will start on 1 May 2018.
The estimated value of the contract including any possible extensions is £840,000.

The Provider shall deliver a range of age and ability appropriate Short Break group activities for disabled children and young people aged 5-18 years old including specific Transitions activities for young people aged 15-18 years old to prepare them for adulthood and transitioning from Children’s Services to Adult’s Services.
The Provider shall support disabled children and young people to learn new skills, socialise, have fun and have the same opportunities that their non-disabled peers have access to.
Transitions Activities shall be age appropriate, fun activities which incorporate independence skills such as travel training and cooking.
Activities may include but are not limited to:
— Sports,
— Arts and crafts,
— Cookery,
— Dance,
— Soft play,
— Sensory activities,
— Independent life skills,
— I.T clubs,
— Youth group activities,
— Spending time in the community with friends,
— Camping weekends/weekends away,
— Concerts/theatre trips.

The Framework is for 3 years with the option to extend the framework for a further 3 years. Therefore, if all extensions were taken, the full length of the contract would be for 6 years. It is anticipated that the contract will start on 1 May 2018.
The estimated value of the contract including any possible extensions is £840,000.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The contract is likely to be renewed at the end of the Framework period.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The Framework is for 3 years with the option to extend the framework for a further 3 years. Therefore, if all extensions were taken, the full length of the contract would be for 6 years.

TITLE.P: Stay and Play activities, 3 — 10 year olds.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Stay and Play activities are Short Break sessions which require a parent/carer to be present, supporting and looking after their child at all times. The staff ratio for Stay and Play activities will be variable and the Provider shall ensure that appropriate levels are available to meet the needs of the children and young people accessing the Service.

Stay and Play sessions shall be available for at least 3 hours, and parents/carers will be able to "drop-in" without booking and can stay for the length of time they require. The Provider shall offer sessions to children and young people with disabilities from the age of 3 to 10 years old.

The Provider shall split children into age and ability appropriate sessions to ensure the safety of all. Children will remain the responsibility of the parent/carer. Siblings of any age or disability shall be able to attend sessions at the discretion of the Provider.
The Provider shall offer a range of unstructured activities which may include but not be limited to:
— Soft Play,
— Sensory Activities,
— Swimming.

The Framework is for 3 years with the option to extend the framework for a further 3 years. Therefore, if all extensions were taken, the full length of the contract would be for 6 years. It is anticipated that the contract will start on 1 May 2018.
The estimated value of the contract including any possible extensions is £840,000.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: The contract is likely to be renewed at the end of the Framework period.

OPTIONS_DESCR.P: The Framework is for 3 years with the option to extend the framework for a further 3 years. Therefore, if all extensions were taken, the full length of the contract would be for 6 years.

FRAMEWORK.JUSTIFICATION: The Council is carrying out this procurement under the Light touch regime pursuant to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 to procure the Most Economically Advantageous Tender (MEAT) (as outlined within the EU Procurement Directives) which best meets the Council’s requirements. During the tender process, the Council may adopt a negotiated procedure.

INFO_ADD.P: All tenders are sealed and electronically opened by the Council's Democratic services.

ESTIMATED_TIMING.P: It is likely to be retendered in 6 years time.
